it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Common.Game

Class ResourceSet

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Common.Game.ResourceSet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<ResourceSet>

    public class ResourceSet
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<ResourceSet>
    ResourceSet is the way the game handles all the resources of the client (ResourceSet contains coins and points as well). Internally a ResourceSet is represented with an HashMap, which map a type of resource (COINS, WOOD, STONE, ...) with the respectively quantity owned by the player

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> resourceSet 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ResourceSet()
      initialize an empty resource set
      ResourceSet(com.eclipsesource.json.JsonObject jsonResourceSet)
      given a JsonObject representing a ResourceSet, build a new ResourceSet with the resources contained into the JsonObject
      ResourceSet(java.lang.String jsonString)
      given a string representing a ResourceSet, build a new ResourceSet with the resources contained into the string (the string is the equivalent form of a JsonObject)

      • getResource

        public int getResource(java.lang.String resourceName)
        allows to retrive the quantity of one single resource owned by the player
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the int value of the resource owned by the player

        Parameters:

        quantity - the quantity of the resource just added

      • hasNegativeValue

        public boolean hasNegativeValue()
        if true, this ResourceSet has a negative quantity value for one of its resources
        Returns:
        true if the ResourceSet has an item with a negative value

      • addResource

        public void addResource(java.lang.String resourceName,
                        int quantity)
        add the specified quantity to the specified resource. If the resource is not owned by the player, a new voice is created with the specified quantity
        Parameters:
        resourceName - the resource name to which add the specified quantity
        quantity - the quantity to add

      • addResource

        public void addResource(ResourceSet resource)
        sum the ResourceSet passed as parameter to this ResourceSet
        Parameters:
        resource - the ResourceSet to add

      • subResource

        public void subResource(ResourceSet resource)
        subtract the ResourceSet passed as parameter to this ResourceSet
        Parameters:
        resource - the ResourceSet to subtract

      • subResource

        public void subResource(java.lang.String resourceName,
                        int quantity)
        subtract the specified quantity to the specified resource, which must be present when the method is called.
        Parameters:
        resourceName - the resource name to which subtract the specified quantity
        quantity - the quantity to subtract

      • hasResource

        public boolean hasResource(java.lang.String resourceName)
        tells if the client has the specified resource or not
        Parameters:
        resourceName - the name of resource to test the presence
        Returns:
        true if the player owned that type of resource, otherwise false

      • toJson

        public com.eclipsesource.json.JsonObject toJson()
        given a ResourceSet, this method build its JSON representation. very usefull for all the packets which must contain a ResourceSet
        Returns:
        the JsonObject representing this ResourceSet

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Checks whether or not the resourceSet has negative values. If a ResourceSet has negative values it is consider not valid (this is one of the way to check if the action can be assessed as valid or not)
        Returns:
        true if the ResourceSet is a valid ResourceSet, false otherwise

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(ResourceSet resource)
        It returns a comparison between two ResourceSet.
        • -2 if the resource compared is not a subset of this
        • -1 if this.resource is less than input resource
        • 0 if this.resource is equal to input resource
        • 1 if this.resource is more than input resource
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<ResourceSet>
        Parameters:
        resource - input to compare with this.
        Returns:
        one of the possible values

      • toStringPlayer

        public java.lang.String toStringPlayer()
        give a string representation of the resources owned by the player, filtering score fields
        Returns:
        a string representation of only the resources (COINS, WOOD, STONE, SERVANT) owned by the player

      • getDecomposedResourceSetString

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getDecomposedResourceSetString()
        return the string representation of the resources contained into this resourceset, organized in an HashMap structure easy to handle
        Returns:
        an HashMap which map each type of resource with its value, in a printable format

      • contains

        public boolean contains(ResourceSet resource)
        tells if the ResourceSet passed as parameter is contained by this ResourceSet
        Parameters:
        resource - the ResourceSet to test
        Returns:
        true if the ResourceSet passed as argument is contained into this ResourceSet, otherwise false
